reviews.review_msg: A great professor who gave interesting lectures, welcomed questions and gave good feedback. Tim also had comprehensive reviews before each exam which explained what he was looking for. He was also open to slightly changing exam formats based on how students did on previous tests.

One of my my favourite profs I have had at SFU. Lectures were really interesting and it was clear he cared about communicating with students and keeping the class engaging. Contrary to the other reviews here his exams felt really fair and if you read the material and go to lectures there should be no problem. Super interesting class and great prof

1rating bc you cant give 0. Most stressful course. Seriously, how is this a first lev class? There are better breadth-courses out there don't take any classes by him. Talks fast cant keep up, lecture slides only include photos so you need to attend. the exams were SO difficult and his marking is hard as well. I was legit failing at one point

Extremely hard marker! If you hate writing papers dont take his classes! We had to complete a couple papers and one 10 page research paper on a graphic novel in Chicago style which is unheard of for a first year class! His lectures were the worst I have ever taken you have to do all outside studying and research to teach yourself
